title: Gatland's son Bryn - a New Zealander - given special permission by All Blacks to train with Wales
text:
Wales had a new man at training on Wednesday with a familiar surname - Warren Gatland's son Bryn.

Wales asked New Zealand head coach Steve Hansen for special dispensation for Bryn to train with them, which the All Blacks head coach gladly granted.

The 24-year-old New Zealander donned Welsh kit and trained fully, for the first time since badly breaking his foot in a Super Rugby match.

Warren Gatland is busy preparing his Wales side for the World Cup semi-final on Sunday

George North looked in prime condition as he trained on on Wednesday afternoon in Tokyo

Wales take on South Africa with England or New Zealand awaiting them in the final

He suffered the horrible injury when playing for the Highlanders against the Japanese side the Sunwolves in April at the very ground Wales trained at before their World Cup semi-final against the South Africans; the Prince Chichibu Memorial Stadium in Tokyo.

This was the first training session he has been able to attend since that blow and it is understood his father is keen to pick him in his farewell match for the Barbarians against Wales back in Cardiff in late November.

Gatland Snr will coach the old invitational side against Wayne Pivac's Wales at the Principality Stadium.

Gatland's son Bryn (left) trained with Wales on Wednesday after recovering from a broken foot

Gatland Jnr has been following Wales in Japan since last week and attended the 20-19 win over France in Oita.

Head coach Gatland's wife Trudi and daughter Gabby are also out in Japan, and Gabby's fiancé Sam joined Wales at their training ground too.

He has played for New Zealand's touch rugby team.

Earlier in the day Wales new-recruit Owen Lane received his World Cup cap from Prince Charles.

The Prince of Wales is over in Japan for the enthronement of Emperor Naruhito, and joined Wales at their training session ahead of the semi-final match against South Africa.

Aaron Shingler (centre) leads his team-mates through a number of drills in a tough session

Prince Charles made an appearance at training with Gatland and Alun Wyn Jones next to him

Lane, 21, only arrived in Japan on Tuesday and has only trained lightly so far, but was handed his tournament cap by the next in line to the throne.

'For him to come along was brilliant, and I am sure it will give the boys a lift,' said skills coach Neil Jenkins.

'For us, it was just a great honour for him to be there watching us, and hopefully it will give us a boost for Sunday.' And on Lane Jenkins added: 'He has only just got in. Hopefully, he will be up and running on Friday. That's the most important thing for us, getting here as an extra back that we've needed.

'He was probably unlucky to miss out in the first instance. He is a talented player, and I am sure his time while he is here.'
description: WILL KELLEHER IN TOKYO: Wales had a new man at training today with a familiar surname - Warren Gatland's son Bryn. The 24-year-old New Zealander even donned the full Welsh kit.
